title: Errors/Warnings trying installing truffle
body:
Hello and thank you to anyone who may provide a solution and thanks to those who attempt to. Here is my issue. I try and install truffle. I get a bunch of warnings. then i try "truffle version" and i get the error. all steps and notices are listed below from windows powershell.

PS C:\users\Computer User> npm -v
8.3.0

PS C:\users\Computer User> npm install -g truffle
npm WARN deprecated mkdirp-promise@5.0.1: This package is broken and no longer maintained. 'mkdirp' itself supports promises now, please switch to that.
npm WARN deprecated source-map-url@0.4.1: See https://github.com/lydell/source-map-url#deprecated

PS C:\users\Computer User> truffle version
truffle : The term 'truffle' is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or operable program.
Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.
At line:1 char:1
+ truffle version
+ ~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ObjectNotFound: (truffle:String) [], CommandNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : CommandNotFoundException


## Environment

* Operating System: win10
* Ethereum client:
* Truffle version (`truffle version`): ERROR
* node version (`node --version`): 17.3.1
* npm version (`npm --version`): 8.3.0

A couple of things:
1. Truffle is not fully compatible with npm version 8 - can you try downgrading to version 6 and installing again?
2. Node version 17 is not a stable version, the odd numbers are sort of "maintenance" versions and Node themselves say that production applications shouldn't use odd numbered versions - try downgrading to Node 16 (you can check out [this article about Node versioning](https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/))
3. What terminal are you using?

> A couple of things:
> 
> 1. Truffle is not fully compatible with npm version 8 - can you try downgrading to version 6 and installing again?
> 2. Node version 17 is not a stable version, the odd numbers are sort of "maintenance" versions and Node themselves say that production applications shouldn't use odd numbered versions - try downgrading to Node 16 (you can check out [this article about Node versioning](https://nodejs.org/en/about/releases/))
> 3. What terminal are you using?

Thank you for replying.
1. Okay had no idea. will attempt to do just that. any particular version of version 6?
2. Same as number 1 above. any particular version of version 16?
3. VS Code latest version and powershell

Thanks for the info. New to this and had no idea.
Let me know how it goes!

Hi @stoic84, Node 16 _should_ work, but to be safe, do mind trying these versions?

npm - `6.14.15`
node - `14.18.3`

> Hi @stoic84, Node 16 _should_ work, but to be safe, do mind trying these versions?
> 
> npm - `6.14.15` node - `14.18.3`



> Let me know how it goes!

----------------------------------------------
hello thank you for your reply and recommendations. i will say this, with your provided versions, i did see something new and looked like it actually installed. ended up with it saying:

+ truffle@5.4.30

but after it "installed" i typed - "truffle version" and it gave the same "truffle: the term is not recognized as the name of a cmdlet, function, script file...."

so does that mean it's not installed? please look at the powershell output of my installation process. you can see the versions installed before truffle installation. please let me know if i'm good or not. thanks a million.


PS C:\> npm -v
6.14.15
PS C:\> node -v
v14.18.3

So if you get that message about "truffle" not being recognized on the command line it means there is something misconfigured about your npm installation. Normally the directory in which globally installed packages are put gets added to your `$PATH` environment variable which allows them to be executed. I would probably say try re-installing Node and npm with a node version manager. This is what npm itself recommends and you can check out [this article](https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally). If you do it correctly it should kind of reconfigure how npm operates on your machine and hopefully solve the problem.

I initially installed with a node manager. I will try again. Also will look
into the path recommendation. Thank you.

Basically that error message is saying to you "hey, I checked all the directories in your `$PATH` variable and none of them contained a package named "truffle". So wherever your npm installation installed Truffle needs to be added.
